datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to clothing, style trends, and runway shows.

columns.name: fashion_show_location
columns.description: Location of the fashion show

columns.name: international_investor_presence
columns.description: Presence of investors from outside the fashion designer's origin country

columns.name: percentage_new_designers
columns.description: Percentage of runway slots allocated to designers who debuted in the last five years

columns.name: audience_approval_rating
columns.description: Percentage of audience approval

columns.name: design_innovation_score
columns.description: A calculated score based on the use of non-traditional materials and unique construction techniques

columns.name: count_international_designers
columns.description: Number of international designers participating in the fashion show

columns.name: num_designer_runway_appearances
columns.description: Number of appearances by the designer in major runway events

columns.name: local_fashion_magazine_circulation
columns.description: Annual circulation numbers of major fashion magazines within the designer's home country

columns.name: number_of_models
columns.description: Number of models in the show

columns.name: average_profit_margin_previous_collections
columns.description: Average profit margin from the designer's previous collections

columns.name: ensemble_type
columns.description: Type of textile used in clothing ensemble

columns.name: venue_type
columns.description: Type of venue where the fashion show is held

columns.name: is_in_europe
columns.description: Binary indicator if the fashion show is located in Europe

columns.name: external_temperature
columns.description: External temperature in degrees Celsius on the day of the fashion show

columns.name: number_of_fashion_design_schools
columns.description: Total number of fashion design schools in the designer's home country

columns.name: percentage_luxury_brands
columns.description: Percentage of luxury brands featured in the fashion show

columns.name: month_of_year
columns.description: Month in which the fashion show is held, as an integer (1-12)

columns.name: has_sponsorship
columns.description: Indicates if the fashion show has a financial or product sponsorship

columns.name: social_media_trend_popularity
columns.description: Popularity rating of the fashion show on social media platforms

columns.name: designer_origin_gdp_per_capita
columns.description: GDP per capita of the country from where the fashion designer originates

queries.question: What is the relationship between venue type, percentage of luxury brands, and social media trend popularity in the fashion design dataset?
queries.true_hypothesis: The social media trend popularity of a fashion show is calculated by taking 90% of the percentage of luxury brands featured and adding 20 when the show is held indoors.
